cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to turn due west and make landfall along the south-central Texas coast before drifting inland toward northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast near or just north of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coastline from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward through High Island, including Corpus Christi, Freeport, Galveston Bay and adjacent barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to 35–40 mph possible in outer rainbands Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of about 1–2 ft possible in Galveston Bay and nearby bays; major (>3 ft) surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could deliver 3–5 inches with isolated higher totals, producing brief flash-flooding in low-lying/poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Upper Texas coast beginning Friday and persisting through Saturday.
